description.plain:
Cavetown is the stage name of singer-songwriter Robin Skinner (he/they), born December 15, 1998, from Cambridge, England.

As of December 2020, Robbie has released six independent albums, two EPs, six single tracks, and five collaborative splits (which form a mixtape). He was the special guest of a split in which they performed a remake of one of his older songs, “Devil Town.”

Robbie’s increasing success allows them to perform gigs internationally. He has toured Europe and went on a US summer tour supported by Chloe Moriondo in 2019.

On September 17, 2019, mxmtoon’s debut album, the masquerade was released. This was a milestone not only for Maia but also for Robbie, as he was the producer and co-writer for all 10 tracks on the album.

Their sixth studio album, Sleepyhead, was released on March 27, 2020.

Since then, Robbie has released his EP Man’s Best Friend on June 4, 2021, and a number of singles including a cover of “Teenage Dirtbag” by Wheatus, featuring Chloe Moriondo.

Robbie’s fifth studio album, worm food, released on November 4, 2022, featuring collaborations with the likes of Vic Fuentes from Pierce The Veil and Chloe Moriondo.

In 2023, Cavetown launched his biggest live tour, Bittersweet Daze. With a total of seven other artists over two tours, the event ended with a headline show at their largest venue to date, Alexandra Palace.
